subject: Philosophy
title: Can We Know Anything for Sure?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Can We Know Anything for Sure? usable.

hook.text: Every time you feel certain, a philosopher has a reason you might be wrong.

buildup.text: Your senses deceive you. Optical illusions prove your brain fills in gaps constantly.

discovery.text: Even math depends on axioms we choose to accept. Change the axioms and geometry changes.

twist.text: Science doesn't prove things true. It only fails to disprove them â€” temporarily.

climax.text: Certainty may be impossible, but useful knowledge doesn't require it. Probability is enough.

punchline.text: We can't be certain. We can be careful.

quiz.question: Why can't science provide absolute certainty?
options: It can only fail to disprove, not prove
The equipment is never accurate enough
